element.name: On reflection, it's a cache! by Hezekiah, Unknown Cache (1.5/1.5)

center.font: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

p.b: THIS CACHE CAN ONLY BE SOUGHT DURING THE HOURS OF DARKNESS – YOU WILL NEED TO BRING A GOOD TORCH WITH YOU!!

long-description.p: Park in the vicinity of N 53º 21.405 W 006º 19.472 – this used to be a through road, but is now blocked at one end, entry is across the road from the Papal Cross car park.

Proceed to the coordinates at the top of the page and use your torch to find a reflector about 1 metre above ground. Go to the reflector and shine your torch to your right – go to that reflector and seek the next one, and so on. When you see 3 reflectors (all on the same structure), shine your torch to your right and continue the process – at the third round reflector, look for the cache!
All reflectors are approximately 1 metre above ground, and you should be able to see the next reflector from each one, but if you take shortcuts you may lose the trail!

element.encoded-hints: To find the first reflector, walk along the path / cycleway towards the main road.

ul.li:
2009-12-10T20:00:00Z : Found it by dino-irl
20:25
A great cache made all the more interesting with the colourful company. Thanks to the usual suspects for guiding me along this one and especially to Spark_ie for making the most effort to get here, despite the fact that he kept wanting to hold my hand [:O]
If anyone is doing this cache and has transport then there's a fantastic Italian restaurant in Castleknock that we went to afterwards [:D]
TNLNSL TFTC #433

2009-11-25T20:00:00Z : Found it by Spark_ie
Decided to have a go off this guy tonight seen as the weather was good for a cycle! Got to the starting co-ords and took a little bit of searching to get the initial reflector.. Lost the track at one stage, but guessed at where the next one would be and picked it up again. From there it was easy going from reflector to reflector, although I probably could have done with a stronger light. Ground was a bit soggy, but got to the final co-ords no problems. Great idea for a cache, up there with the very best ! TFTC, Spark_ie

2009-11-10T20:00:00Z : Found it by anacreon
What's also reflective in torchlight? The tapetum lucidum of the park deer. I was quite surprised to find 6 reflectors on the first torch sweep, especially moving ones.
Having spotting the first fixed reflector it wasn't too hard to follow the trail, despite the looming ground fog. Found the final reflector under the watchful gaze of another deer (stag, I think) and signed the logbook with torch-in-mouth, in forest, at night, with onlooking woodland creatures. This is not your usual geocache :)

2009-10-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by Lahtac
First Night Cache. Brilliant. Found this nice and easy as part of OBCLAN team. TFTC Lahtac

2009-10-19T19:00:00Z : Found it by Toffee Man
Found with Eily –signed log as Mot TFTC Toffee Man #24

2008-11-08T20:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Found as part of the flashmob group - amazing how much those reflectors look exactly like deer eyes...

wpt.name: GC1HX3D
wpt.desc: On reflection, it's a cache! by Hezekiah, Unknown Cache (1.5/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: On reflection, it's a cache!
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
THIS CACHE CAN ONLY BE SOUGHT DURING THE HOURS OF DARKNESS – YOU WILL NEED TO BRING A GOOD TORCH WITH YOU!!


Park in the vicinity of N 53º 21.405 W 006º 19.472 – this used to be a through road, but is now blocked at one end, entry is across the road from the Papal Cross car park.

Proceed to the coordinates at the top of the page and use your torch to find a reflector about 1 metre above ground. Go to the reflector and shine your torch to your right – go to that reflector and seek the next one, and so on. When you see 3 reflectors (all on the same structure), shine your torch to your right and continue the process – at the third round reflector, look for the cache!

All reflectors are approximately 1 metre above ground, and you should be able to see the next reflector from each one, but if you take shortcuts you may lose the trail!


Additional Waypoints
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: To find the first reflector, walk along the path / cycleway towards the main road.
